meanings.definition: Having the ability to refract light.
meanings.sent1: The refractive glass lens helped focus the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The refractive properties of the prism created a beautiful rainbow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf used a refractive crystal to play tricks on his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a refractive mirror, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The refractive nature of the diamond made it sparkle like a star.

meanings.definition: The bending of light as it passes through a medium.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the phenomenon of refractive light in water.
meanings.sent2: The refraction of light through the lens of the camera created a clear image.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a clever use of refractive properties.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like the refractive path of a beam of light.
meanings.sent5: The refractive effect in the glass sculpture was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A measure of how much a substance can bend light.
meanings.sent1: The refractive index of the diamond indicated its purity.
meanings.sent2: The refractive measurement of the liquid determined its optical density.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient had a surprising refractive quality.
meanings.sent4: His words had a refractive impact on her perspective.
meanings.sent5: The refractive level of the lens affected the clarity of the image.
